title: 110_hr251
content: The "Truth in Caller ID Act of 2007" prohibits the manipulation of caller identification information. The Communications Act of 1934 was amended to include a new subsection (e) that prohibits the transmission of misleading caller identification information with the intent to defraud or cause harm. This amendment aims to prevent deceptive practices in telecommunications and VOIP services. The new subsection (e) of the Communications Act of 1934 prohibits the blocking of caller identification information and requires the Commission to implement regulations within 6 months. The Commission will also review regulations for non-commercial calls using artificial or pre-recorded voices. The new subsection (e) of the Communications Act of 1934 prohibits misleading or inaccurate caller identification information. It does not affect investigative, protective, or intelligence activities by law enforcement or intelligence agencies. The Telephone Consumer Protection Act of 1991 prohibits misleading caller identification information. Definitions include caller identification information and caller identification service. The curr_chunk provides information on the origination of calls made using telecommunications or VOIP services, including automatic number identification services. VOIP service is defined as a real-time voice communication service transmitted through end user equipment using TCP/IP protocol, offered to the public, and capable of originating calls. The curr_chunk states that a service must have the capability to originate or terminate traffic from the public switched telephone network. The House of Representatives passed the bill on June 12, 2007.
